title: `BYTE` has incorrect semantics
body:
**Abstract**
The current documentation surrounding `BYTE` says that the first 8 bits of the resultant value pushed onto the stack will potentially be non-zero. I think this is incorrect and should rather be the last 8 bits.

**Conventions**
The following is the equation in the `Description` section of `BYTE`. I'll refer to it as `Eq(1)`.

![](https://i.imgur.com/lQGNyAp.png)

**Lemma: `\mu_S[x]_0` refers to the most-significant, left-most, first bit**
I provide two justifications for this lemma:

1.
In `SIGNEXTEND`, we want a non-zero number of least-significant, right-most, last bits to remain intact. The only way for the current documentation of `SIGNEXTEND` to achieve that behavior is that `\mu_S[x]_255` refers to the least-significant, right-most, last bit.

2.
The docs of `BYTE` specify that byte-counting is from most-significant, left-most, first byte. Based on the bit-indexing of the first case of the RHS (right-hand side) of `Eq(1)` it is clear that `\mu_S[x]_0` refers to the most-significant, left-most, first bit.

Now, to illustrate the bug:

**Justification**
Let us assume `\mu_S[0] < 32`. `Eq(1)` says that the most-significant, left-most, first 8 bits of the result pushed onto the stack will be equal to the first case on the RHS of `Eq(1)`. I checked in `ethereumjs-vm`, and based on #729 all other implementations including KEVM instead set the 8 least-significant, right-most, last bits.

**Correction**
The first case of the RHS should be:

```latex
\mu_S[1]_{i - 248 + 8\mu_s[0]} \text{ if } i \geq 248 \land \mu_S[0] < 32
```

![](https://latex.codecogs.com/png.latex?%5Clarge%20%5Cmu_S%5B1%5D_%7B%28i%20-%20248%20+%208%5Cmu_s%5B0%5D%29%7D%20%5Ctext%7B%20if%20%7D%20i%20%5Cgeq%20248%20%5Cland%20%5Cmu_S%5B0%5D%20%3C%2032)

This will ensure that the least-significant, right-most, last byte of the result pushed onto the stack is equal to the indexed byte. The alternative is that all EVM implementations are incorrect, and I firmly believe it is a bug instead in the YP.

**Source link** 
https://github.com/ethereum/yellowpaper/blob/80085f71210bde2fbb7d161ab3359e54d8360d94/Paper.tex#L2121-L2124

**Previous work**
This has been previously reported in #729 , but ended up being closed by the author.
